de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.phone

Class PhoneDragHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.AbstractDragHandler<PhoneDragHandler.Callback>
      • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.phone.PhoneDragHandler

  • public class PhoneDragHandler
extends AbstractDragHandler<PhoneDragHandler.Callback>
    A drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events, when using the smartphone layout.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PhoneDragHandler.Callback
      Defines the interface, a class, which should be notified about the events of a drag handler, must implement.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.AbstractDragHandler

        AbstractDragHandler.DragState

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhoneDragHandler(TabSwitcher tabSwitcher, Arithmetics arithmetics, de.mrapp.android.util.view.AttachedViewRecycler<TabItem,?> viewRecycler)
      Creates a new drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events, when using the smartphone layout.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected TabItem getFocusedTab(float position)
      The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to retrieve the tab item, which corresponds to the tab, which is focused when clicking/dragging at a specific position.
      protected boolean isSwipeThresholdReached(TabItem swipedTabItem)
      Returns, whether the threshold of a swiped tab item, which causes the corresponding tab to be removed, has been reached, or not.
      protected float onOvershootEnd(float dragPosition, float overshootThreshold)
      The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when the tabs are overshooting at the end.
      protected void onOvershootReverted()
      The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when an overshoot has been reverted.
      protected float onOvershootStart(float dragPosition, float overshootThreshold)
      The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when the tabs are overshooting at the start.
      protected void onReset()
      The method, which invoked on implementing subclasses, when the drag handler has been reset.

      • Methods inherited from class de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout.AbstractDragHandler

        getArithmetics, getCallback, getTabSwitcher, handleDrag, handleRelease, handleTouchEvent, reset, setCallback

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhoneDragHandler

        public PhoneDragHandler(@NonNull
                        TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                        @NonNull
                        Arithmetics arithmetics,
                        @NonNull
                        de.mrapp.android.util.view.AttachedViewRecycler<TabItem,?> viewRecycler)
        Creates a new drag handler, which allows to calculate the position and state of tabs on touch events, when using the smartphone layout.
        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The tab switcher, whose tabs' positions and states should be calculated by the drag handler, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null
        arithmetics - The arithmetics, which should be used to calculate the position, size and rotation of tabs, as an instance of the type Arithmetics. The arithmetics may not be null
        viewRecycler - The view recycler, which allows to inflate the views, which are used to visualize the tabs, whose positions and states should be calculated by the tab switcher, as an instance of the class AttachedViewRecycler. The view recycler may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • getFocusedTab

        @Nullable
protected final TabItem getFocusedTab(float position)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDragHandler
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to retrieve the tab item, which corresponds to the tab, which is focused when clicking/dragging at a specific position.
        Specified by:
        getFocusedTab in class AbstractDragHandler<PhoneDragHandler.Callback>
        Parameters:
        position - The position on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        The tab item, which corresponds to the focused tab, as an instance of the class TabItem or null, if no tab is focused

      • onOvershootStart

        protected final float onOvershootStart(float dragPosition,
                                       float overshootThreshold)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDragHandler
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses, when the tabs are overshooting at the start.
        Overrides:
        onOvershootStart in class AbstractDragHandler<PhoneDragHandler.Callback>
        Parameters:
        dragPosition - The position of the pointer on the dragging axis in pixels as a Float value
        overshootThreshold - The position on the dragging axis, an overshoot at the start currently starts at, in pixels as a Float value
        Returns:
        The updated position on the dragging axis, an overshoot at the start starts at, in pixels as a Float value

      • isSwipeThresholdReached

        protected final boolean isSwipeThresholdReached(@NonNull
                                                TabItem swipedTabItem)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDragHandler
        Returns, whether the threshold of a swiped tab item, which causes the corresponding tab to be removed, has been reached, or not.
        Overrides:
        isSwipeThresholdReached in class AbstractDragHandler<PhoneDragHandler.Callback>
        Parameters:
        swipedTabItem - The swiped tab item as an instance of the class TabItem. The tab item may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the threshold has been reached, false otherwise
